intro: Tithymalus nevadensis, commonly known as the Nevada tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, and its flowers are small and clustered in a head. Tithymalus nevadensis is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often found in mountainous regions.
